description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ei5ak","text":"This protocol employs a novel, open-source automated pipeline scripted entirely in shell for analyzing metagenomic data from various samples.  Designed to streamline the workflow, the pipeline integrates functionalities for pathogen identification, antimicrobial resistance (AMR) gene detection, and listing the probable antibiotics to which the genes are resistant.  This user-friendly pipeline eliminates the need for manual tools installation and configuration, simplifying the analysis process.  It directly analyzes raw sequencing reads, if there is presence of appropriate reference genomes and runs through the pipeline for each sample. This protocol runs nine tools together, with just one input given at the start of the program. Demonstrated using publicly available data on both a desktop Linux system and a high-performance computing cluster, the pipeline acknowledges potential variations arising from different software tools and versions, providing users the flexibility to modify them as needed. This approach offers a robust solution for metagenomic data analysis from varied samples, facilitating efficient and accurate detection and uncovering of hidden AMR hotspots.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auad0","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c03fu","text":"Keywords: AMR gene prediction, metagenomics, automated pipeline, shell scripting","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":80}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"733na","text":"SPAdes is a genome assembly tool which works on de Bruijn Graph algorithm that reconstructs the entire genomes sequence by reading the fragments. It provides simplified graphs for the user. The tool measures the distance between k-mers and adjusts the scores to accurate distances. The contig file generated has valuable information and are high-quality assemblies that are optimized and analyzed for sequenced data. {"blocks":[{"key":"emehp","text":"Metaphlan is the most diversely used computational tool to perform microbial profiling. It mainly focuses on metagenomic shot-gun sequencing data. The database has pre-defined markers specific to the microbial community and the sequencing data aligns against the database. The assigned reads are taxonomical labels to the given samples. It provides insights in composition and diversity of microbial populations. It is essential to determine the microbes in agriculture, health-disease, pathology and food production. {"blocks":[{"key":"39g1r","text":"This study thus introduces an open-source pipeline for streamlined and quick analysis of metagenomic data from various samples.  Scripted entirely in shell, it integrates pathogen identification, AMR gene detection, and antibiotic resistance prediction. The pipeline directly analyzes raw reads whose quality checks have been completed priorly, eliminating manual tool setup and simplifying workflows.  Demonstrated on diverse samples, it offers flexibility for customization and facilitates efficient AMR gene detection. Thus, this workflow may be applied to diverse range of samples to uncover any hidden AMR hotspots.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5oha8","text":"We would like to thank Dr. Akshatha Prasanna, Assistant Professor, Department of Biotechnology, Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering for her inspiring work that led us to this study. The authors are also extremely grateful to Mr. Akshay Uttarkar, Research Scholar at RV College of Engineering, for providing all his valuable inputs.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eibcr","text":"Special thanks to our research interns Vasupradha SH, Shreya Vinod and Rajnee Joel for helping the authors run the protocol for different samples.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: STITCHING THESE CODES TOGETHER - FORMULATING WHOLE PIPELINE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ekm9b","text":"These individual codes for each tool were stitched together thereby automating the entire protocol for easy use. All users who would like to use this protocol may choose to stitch the code to run the workflow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
